string:
Nt = Ns*(St/Ss)*M/(M+D), where Ns is the number of neurons counted, St is the total number of sections in the brain region, Ss is the number of sections sampled, M is the thickness of section, and D is the average diameter of counted cells, as previously described13,14.

 

3).
Measure rotation 5 min following the injection for 10 min, as previously described<sup>19,20</sup> and only count full-body turns.
refer: The phrase "as previously described" refers to the method of measuring rotation that was mentioned earlier in the text.

string: Perform rotation test induced by D-amphetamine (Sigma, 5 mg/kg) in the same system, as previously described<sup>21,22</sup>.
refer: In the sentence provided, "as previously described" refers to the method of performing the rotation test.

string:
Express the data as net contralateral or ipsilateral turns per min.

 

7). To perform the cylinder test, place mouse into a glass cylinder (diameter 19 cm, height 25 cm), with mirrors placed behind for a full view of all touches, as previously described19,23.
refer: In the sentence provided, "as previously described" refers to the method of performing the cylinder test, which includes placing the mouse into a glass cylinder with mirrors placed behind for a full view of all touches.
